intro: Lotononis maximiliani, commonly known as the African violet or violet groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant.
